p: The natural dominant PVX resistance gene Rx, which confers extreme resistance to a wide spectrum of PVX strains, has been isolated from potato and introduced to PVX-susceptible plants by genetic engineering [ 46]. Furthermore, virus specificity of the Rx gene has been extended by mutation [ 47 â€¢ ]. Thus, there are plenty of opportunities to improve virus resistance in existing potato varieties. Perhaps the ongoing efforts to obtain approval for transgenic late-blight-resistant potato varieties in Uganda and Bangladesh will pave the way for [transgenic] virus resistance in the future.
